intro: Encelia nutans, commonly known as the spreading encelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grayish-green, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Encelia nutans plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
